Reviews.Title: WOW - Get This Samsung LED
Reviews.Author: A. Landry "AL"
Reviews.Content: Pros:Appearance:From the get go, I pulled thing out of the box, and I was impressed on the thiness. Next I put it on the bezel stand and put it in our armoire and was completely awed at the cleaness and style.Set Up:was a breeze, got on my WiFi right away, updated the firmware and away we went.Movies:I hooked up my media PC to it, with over 400 HD movies I have, I ran at least 10 movies on it. First I went simple, TRON with Auto Motion is crisp and clean and lifelike I do not know how you go back to regular viewing ever again. Next I tried 3D and threw in How to Train Your Dragon, and it was so clear and clean and had such good depth perception I was totally impressed.Color:I have a Plasma TV Panasonic 42" and this Samsung LED kills it, it bar non has better color and clarity without a second thought.Sound:Very clean and very strong however it lacks bass to be expected with its thinness, but sounds great enough to fill a 15x15 room with sound.Cons:The stand:comes out to far, its a nick pick but I wish at least in the front of it it was short so it didn't come out so far past the screen.Auto Motion Stuttering:I love, but if you are streaming, it will stutter every 20 sec or so if you don have a clean connection. Which I didnt, so I went out and bought a Netgear Powerline 500av and it fixed that issueFound here on amazon( amazon.com/gp/product/B004DVEW8I ).For those of you who do not know what Powerline is, its a way to extend your Ethernet connection through your power lines to any room in your house, my tv is down stairs, even though the WiFi is built in to the TV it was not strong enough to get 1080p without hiccups even on my Wireless N Router, due to interference most likely. I love auto motion, its the reason why I bought this TV.Flashlights:the term used to describe the LED light leaks in the corner of the screen in really black scenes, its not bad but its there.Smart Hub\All Share:has a long way to go, still to cluttered, most things cost money, and all share is a pain, your better off hooking a pc up and streaming from it, as all share does NOT play MKVs and has trouble with MP4s. It doesnt do a direct connect to it instead uses its folder structure and its a mess. Music and Pics all worked fine. All Share is not fluid and easy to set up as of yet.BottomLine:The TV software has some tweaks to really make it multimedia like most TVs are trying to pull off, and LED lighting issues are there but very small seems to be common however: this is a LED TV and it main purpose is for watching movies and video and I have a very nice plasma and I have seen the amazon show floor (called best buy) and looked at all kinds of LEDs and even Samsung very own 8000 series, and I still think this is the best of the line period, I am picking up a 55" soon of the 6500 to go in my media room, get this LED you will absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: So far GREAT
Reviews.Author: AnObservation
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Amazon a week ago and so far I am enjoying it very much. It is my 3rd LCD flat screen over almost as many years as they have been on the market. This is far better the one I purchased 2 years ago. The picture is outstanding, almost too good. Some people who watch it with me say it looks too real and not like a TV and shows detail you were not meant to see. I do not consider that a negative. The SMART TV variety of options including Samsung Apps are fairly good and extensive but sadly do not include Amazon which tempted me to knock the rating down to 4 stars. The set up and use of the apps and other features is not as intuitive as it could be and that probably does knock the rating down to 4 and half stars. Many of the Apps like with apple ipod you have to purchase, others claim to be free but after you connect you have to pay a fee.The caveat being I have yet to connect a 3-D source or buy the glasses. So I can not review that aspect of the TV. The picture in 2-D is very 3-D as you truly get the illusion of depth because of the picture quality and you do not have to mess with glasses. I will soon take the 3-D plunge and hopefully amend this review to include that aspect.But if you want a great picture in your bedroom, it is bright with tons of contrast and exceptionally sharp. It is quite glossy and those with light source issues may consider a less reflective TV to avoid reflected light on the screen.I purchased this just after it came out and the price dropped today. I have every confidence that Amazon who always has treated me better than any other retailer will live up to the price reduction guarantee. Again I will attempt to follow up with this review and let everyone know how that price guarantee worked for me.Additional information:  Amazon informed me they have refunded the difference in price I paid and the current lower price on Amazon. I am so happy with Amazon for going beyond what any other retailer does.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Alex Ivanov
Reviews.Content: Awesome TV! I was a little hesitant to buy it because of the lack of reviews, but really glad I did. This is Samsung's entry level 3D 2011 model, but the only thing indicating that is the price. I'm not sure if you can get a better deal on a 55" 3D capable LED TV.PROS: Looks awesome, 0.5" bezel makes it look great! WiFi is built-in, so no need to spend another $60 on an adapter.CONS: There really aren't any, besides being able to tweak a lot of picture settings which can be a burden for people with OCD :)

Reviews.Title: ¡¡Absolutely great!!
Reviews.Author: Jack24
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV last august the 4th, so it's a really recent purchase. The reasons why I decided to buy it were its size, resolution, and obviously the 3D capability. I didn't think too much about it before, but let me warn you, this TV is FAR BEYOND that. This is an absolutely ultimate technology device, and this why I say it:1. The size of the screen is incredible when it comes the time to play games. I have a PlayStation 3 connected to the TV through an HDMI cable, and the colors, resolution, and overall performance of the TV are really out of this world. If you play games in an Full HD widescreen you can really see much more detail than in other TVs, no matter how big they are, which is great if you play Fifa or combat planes related games.2. To watch a movie, this is like having a real cinema in your own home. We have been watching some BD movies on the TV, and it delivers a detail I hadn't seen before, except in the theaters. The colors are crisp, vivid and real: The black is really black, not a dark gray like on other screens, so the contrast is really, really good.3. Fortunatelly for us, the TV came with its own 3D glasses set included (2 units), and let me tell you, the 3D experience of this TV is better than the one you can enjoy in your nearest theater, or at least the same, since you're closer to the source. I didn't have to buy a separate Blu-Ray Player since the PlayStation 3 has this feature included, and it also reproduces 3D content (if you didn't know this, now you do). We enjoyed to see "MegaMind" in 3D in our own home... and it was faaar better than watching it on a theater. I couldn't believe it. I tried this with a 3D powered game like Gran Turismo 5, and pfff... I don't really have words to describe it. It's almost like driving in a real race. Now, to the previous buyer who said that the TV in 2D is almost 3D: I seriously suggest you to buy the glasses and try with a 3D BD. The TV is great in 2D, but in 3D, the word would far beyond "awesome". When you try it in 3D, you'll notice there is a huge, huge diference.4. If you have a laptop, you'll find very interesting that you can connect it to the TV through any of their 4 HDMI ports, and get a great screen to do some work, watch some videos or photographs with your family and friends, or fool around the Internet.The cons:5. When it comes to the smart part, I think this part could have been a little bit better. I don't know how Samsung didn't think in a more intuitive keyboard or a different way to allow users to connect a physical keyboard to the TV (maybe there is a solution out there so I'll have to investigate further, but I think this part can be improved). Maybe this is the only con of the TV, but since its primary function is not this (you can have a computer for that), I will still give it five stars.I absolutely recommend this item if you're thinking to buy it.

Reviews.Title: Nice television
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: I have been shopping televisions online for about a month, comparing specs, reading reviews, and looking at places like Consumer Reports and CNET for advice.  About all I learned is that it can be pretty confusing.  I decided that I wanted to be able to stream movies from sites like Netflix and (because of the location of my router)that I would need a wifi television.  I also learned that "wifi ready" does not really mean wifi ready, it just means that the tv is ready for you to spend another $80 or so on an adapter.  Therefore this cost had to be factored in.  I decided on LED over plasma because of the burn-in issues with plasma.I had narrowed my choice down to Sharp, Samsung, or Sony.  All of them seemed to have an excellent picture, weak sound, and some problems with light bleeding.  I was ready to buy a 46 inch Samsung D6000 for about $1000 when I found this D6500 with built in wifi (no adapter needed), 3D capability, 2 pairs of glasses, and a free blue ray player for less than $1200.  I decided this was about what the D6000 would cost after I bought the adapter and blu ray player.  And I would get 3D as a bonus.So far, the television has been great.  I went through all of the set-up stuff and had the thing connected, firm wear updated, and was watching a program in less than 30 minutes.  The picture seemed fine right out of the box so I didn't mess with it.  The sound is better that I expected.  It is loud enough and the quality is fine for regular programs, but I might add a soundbar later to enhance the movie experience.  I had expected to buy the soundbar right away because I have a 24,000 btu air conditioner roaring about 20 feet from the television and I was concerned that the "micro speakers" in any flat screen would not be sufficient, but I run the sound up to about 65 (on a scale of 100) and I have no problem hearing.  I do have a small amount of light bleeding at each corner.  The ONLY time this can be noticed is in a very dark room on a black screen that has a small lighted area.  (My music channels have an information box that floats around a black screen, and this is when I can see a slight bleeding in the corners)  I can't see it any other time and I don't consider it a problem.After Dish hooked me up to high-def, the closed caps would not come on.  Dish said it was a television problem and Samsung told me that closed caption would not work when an HDMI cable is used. So, as they say, when all else failed I read the instructions.  The book for the Dish receiver clearly told me how to turn the caps on, and they work great.I tried the 3D feature, using some of the sample clips that are include, and found it interesting, but not something I really want to watch.  My wife, on the other hand, loves it.  So, I guess I am glad we have it but glad we did not spend extra to get it.I would buy this television again.

Reviews.Title: My Second UN46X6500
Reviews.Author: eman
Reviews.Content: Last July I bought the UN46C6500 and recently published a short review on that model.Based on the UN46C6500 the new UN46D6500 is much improved.  A thinner bevel around the edges now makes the set 42" wide vs 43" last year the power sound & channel buttons are now on the rear of the set instead of along the bottom bevel. The set is 3D capable, there is built in WIFI  and it still gets an amazing picture.  Set up was a breeze with easy to follow menus. I wish the remote was friendlier(same complaint about the C6500).The only real issue was with the shipping and delivery of 2 of the four items sent in the order.  One pair of 3D glasses was sent in a box, the other in a padded envelope via UPS. Of course the one in the padded envelope was crushed when it arrived,(DUH). The HDMI cable I ordered had better packaging, double boxed!The TV was sent UPS ground, and as I expected, it was damaged(the back panel was dented in two places). Amazon should know better than using ground UPS for a shipment like this as UPS doesn't respect package labeling. I know that the dimensions barely allow the use of UPS to avoid oversize shipping rates but a $1250 panel presents a great risk.Amazon Customer Service quickly resolved my problems.  When I explained that the HDTV was a gift for the day after delivery, Amazon replaced the order with another sent via FedEx air overnight for a Saturday delivery at no extra charge.They also provided me additional incentive on the purchase for the problems.Great Customer Service Amazon.

Reviews.Title: patchy display on gray
Reviews.Author: N. Loftus
Reviews.Content: this is the second Samsung Smart TV I have purchased in the space of 5 weeks from Amazon....After reading alot of reviews of  different TVs I decided Samsung seemed to be the 'it' TV of the moment from a quality perspective and I purchased the previous 40'' model UN40D6400 for $882 - (list price $1299) which I thought was a great 'open box' purchase from amazon Warehouse deals - and received in like new condition in original box and only missing one screw...unfortunately the 'side bleed' or 'flashlight'  was really noticeable on a black screen - and more so on the right side of the TV - and this bothered me because LED technology is supposed to have an even backlight as far as I had researched...also there was an intermittent appearance of the pop up menu  - which I read must be to do with electrical interference from another device or wire and it seemed I resolved this issue  - but the flashlight issue was too visible and so I decided to return the TV and start again...I then noticed that a newer Samsung model had since been released from Amazon within the 3 weeks I had taken receipt of the first 40'' TV- the 46'' UN46D6500 with built in Wifi - and I could'nt believe I could get it new in box for $1249 -(list price $1799!!)  including 2 pairs of 3d glasses - I did the math and basically the difference was an extra $300 to get the newer and larger model with glasses and built in WIFI - if I had kept the open box smaller version I would have had to purchase the glasses and separate wifi adapter at additional expense - so it seemed like a no brainer to arrive at spending a little more for alot more feature wise...I have had this 46'' TV for 2 weeks tomorrow - and I find I need to return it  AGAIN...it still has the same side 'light bleed' - although not as bad as the previous model - but I noticed in between changing channels the default gray screen has a really patchy display - with a visible darker 1 + 1/2 '' horizontal band about a 1/4 of the way down from the top of the screen - and another running along the bottom of the TV -  it wouldnt matter so much on the gray screen but it is also visible while watching streamed movies / DVD's depending on the background...So either I am really unlucky or Samsung are having some quality control issues...!?  Anyone else noticing the same as I have described?Apart from the banding issue - the picture is amazing...but now Amazon dont have any more of this model in stock to replace this faulty one for another 1- 2 months - so I am now really inconvenienced to have to return this model (at my expense for shipping) and face having no TV in the interim because Amazon have stated they will not replace it because this is my second return - which I need to resolve with Amazon - I still want this TV - just minus any quality issues!!

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Laura G. "Laura"
Reviews.Content: This is really an amazing TV.  I'm not a big 3D person, but it's pretty incredible to watch 3D Blu-ray in your own home.  Very vivid colors, crystal clear picture, and I think the sound is great (compared to our old 44" Magnavox LCD).  I can't believe how thin it is, too!  I bought at the right time.....the very next day the price increased by $600.  This TV also is one of the top rated on Consumer Reports.One note about the Skype: you have to buy a Samsung Skype camera, which is around $120-$170.  We were disappointed that this wasn't noted anywhere online, and it took a long and frustrating webchat with Samsung to figure out you can't just use any webcam.  Haven't been able to try the Skype feature (very excited to)....our camera should be here this week.Edited 1/20/12: We're also disappointed that there is no web browser.  Seems like that should be an "app" that can be downloaded at least.

Reviews.Title: Great Design; Impressive Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Jet Shine
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a long time for TVs before settling on this one.  I have a room that's 21' x 21', so I wanted a big screen, at least 60".  When the D7000 and D8000 came out, I was immediately drawn to the design, especially the very thin bezel, and many pro reviewers (like CNET) comment on just how good they look. This D6500--and the similar D6400--also have a pretty thin bezel, so I decided the extra features of the D7000 and above really weren't worth the extra $200-400 for me.  My previous TV was a 42" Westinghouse, one of the first mainstream 1080P sets available.  After my bad experience with that brand, I decided no more budget-brand TVs for me, I pretty much had my heart set on a Samsung after seeing them at friends' houses.This TV looks very good when set up, either on the included stand or hanging on a wall, even when turned off.  When you turn it on, there's a definite "WOW!"  The picture quality is very good, and there are multiple picture modes available (Standard, Dynamic, Natural, Movie).  I'll agree with the pros that for movies, the Movie setting looks best, but for most TV content, Standard looks better.  Colors looks accurate to me, and also noticeable are the crispness (clarity) of the image, the deep black levels, detail even in darker areas, and no motion blur at all.  I was concerned that the glossy coating would mean too many reflections as I do have a lot of windows in the room, but it's not really noticeable when the TV is on.  If you're a videophile, there are plenty of settings to tweak the picture to your heart's content, even some built-in test patterns to help you do it.One noticeable detractor for the picture quality: the edge-lighting, while it allows for an impressively thin cabinet, it does impact lighting uniformity.  The result is blooming/light leakage near the four corners, which is more noticeable in dark scenes or black outs.  Full-array LED backlighting doesn't have this problem, but there are few TVs that offer this feature (and are usually quite a bit more money).  It's too bad that a TV this expensive has this issue.By default, the motion enhancement feature is active for all picture modes, so things like movie have a creepy fluidity to them.  Some people like this, I don't; I prefer the cadence of 24 frames per second in movies.  Luckily you can turn off this motion enhancement feature, though the setting is buried deep in the menus.The Smart TV feature is pretty cool, though I probably don't use it as much as I could since I already have many features like this available through my Dish DVR, Sony Bluray Player, and Apple TV.  I *do* use the Netflix service however; it's not the best implementation, but it works, and provides good streaming quality.  Controls are laggy to respond, though.  There are many services available to use through the Smart TV portal, including ones that allow you to buy movie rentals, play games, FaceBook, etc.  There is sometimes a lag switching between applications and the home page.  It's a pretty useful feature, nonetheless, especially if you don't already have another device to do this.  Amazon On Demand is noticeably missing, and it's not especially well integrated; Apple TV has a better interface.The built-in audio is acceptable, but a screen this impressive deserves a surround sound system to match it (I have a 7.1 system with mostly in-wall speakers).I haven't tried the 3D feature yet, as Samsung does not include any 3D glasses, and they weren't running any promotions for free ones at the time I bought it.  3D wasn't a deciding factor for me, though; I just liked the design of this model over the less-expensive D6000 series.  You also get a higher screen "clear motion rate" of 480 compared to the D6000 and built-in wifi compared to the D6000 and D6400.The included remote is pretty nice, with back-lit keys and a good layout.  I use a Logitech Harmony though, since I have several other devices to control.I also seriously considered the Sharp Aquos Quattron Line (UN60LE830U / UN60LE832U), but when viewing those TVs side-by-side with this Samsung, I though the images were noticeably softer on the Sharp, particularly edges like a face against a contrasting background, and the picture didn't quite pop as much as it did on the Samsung.I got the TV through one of Amazon's sellers (Video & Audio Center), everything was pretty smooth with them, though their chosen freight carrier (Manna) was slow; 12 calendar days/ 8 business days to get from the warehouse on the west coast to my home in the northeast.Overall, 4.5 stars, I would dock it for half a star because of the blooming effect as well as the lack of any included 3D glasses.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, some light bleeding on edges
Reviews.Author: A. Paoli
Reviews.Content: Superb TV, super slim, incredible detail and brightness. 240hz not necessary. Only con I can see is that when when the screen goes really black you can see a little bit of grey around the edges where the light bleeds over into the darkness. I assume this is because it's edge lit. The other two reviews hit the nail on the head for wireless - it's really nice to have it built right into the set versus having to get an additional accessory.

Reviews.Title: Love the Smart tv and wifi
Reviews.Author: SC1986
Reviews.Content: Awesome picture, really does give the impression that there is noting but the picture without a frame! super slim too, fits right up against the wall, easy to mount too.  This tv picks up wireless, so you really don't even need anything else!

Reviews.Title: Simply Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Redshorty3
Reviews.Content: This television is just amazing. The picture is crisp...it looks like you can reach out and touch the actors. I'm still learning about all the Smart TV apps, but so far so good. I'm so glad I got this model, since it is wifi capable. That makes things so much easier. All in all, it's a great TV. I upgraded from a smaller LCD. Now, watching TV is a much more rewarding experience. Oh, and the 3D is great too!

Reviews.Title: Nice 4 the price
Reviews.Author: kteare
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome especially in 3D. It would have been nice if the directions showed how to connect a Wii via the component dongle as it's a little confusing, but not a big deal. The only thing that would make this TV better is if Samsung threw in a wireless keyboard and a web browser.Screen is crisp & clean, but I'm a novice viewer.Remote drawback: The arrow keys and the select key are arranged awkwardly. I can't say how many times I have hit the wrong navigation key or have to look at the remote to make sure I have my finger on the select button. It would have been nice for Samsung to have placed a raised dot on the middle button for dark tactile operations.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Setup a Little Tricky!
Reviews.Author: B. Arnholt
Reviews.Content: I have 2 other Samsung LCD TVs (LN46B530, and LN40B530) that I love and have a great picture, so when I wanted to replace my large 65" rear projection TV, Samsung was my first choice.  After review of several models and comparisons to other brands (LG, Sony), I found that the Samsung UN55D6500 offered the best options at the right price.Out of the box, set up was a snap, and I hooked up my DirecTV via HDMI and noticed a very clear picture.  The TV has built-in Wifi, so I connected it to my home network in a snap and it automatically did a software update.  Overall, the setup took less than 10 min.As I watched the TV, I initially didn't change any of the picture settings from the factory defaults.  In a day or two, I noticed what others have called the "Soap Opera Effect", where the picture appears like the picture in Soap Opera shows.  After about a day of checking users groups and forums, I found that the most probable cause was the AutoMotion Plus and LED Motion settings (which are defaulted to be on).  As I learned more about the TV settings and played around, I was able to fine tune the picture to my liking.Overall, its a great TV for the price, but the calibration and tuning of the picture to my liking took some time and was not intuitive.  I'd would have liked to have had a calibration DVD to use for fine tuning to my particular preferences.  So, I highly recommend the TV, but be prepared to spend some time fine-tuning the picture to your particular settings.

Reviews.Title: In a word "AMAZING"
Reviews.Author: L. Sullivan "Luvmy3girls"
Reviews.Content: Christmas present from the parents.  Finally upgraded our living room tv now that the little ones are 7 and 5 and 2 no chance of this getting ruined.  Have been a Samsung loyalist.  Researched out the Ying Yang before deciding on this one.  Can't get my Dad out of our living room now.  There just aren't words.  The picture is outstanding, the smarttv capabilities excellent, sound is terrific - it offers so much.  Family movie night now happens in our living room - Fantastic!! Also, one added bonus as it was a factor in purchasing we get a lot of direct sunlight in our living room that with our old school tv made viewing impossible.  Sunlight directly beaming on this beauty doesn't affect the picture one bit.  Superb!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great after a calibration
Reviews.Author: Pbeach
Reviews.Content: I bought this t.v. because of reviews, samsung reputation, and the amazon price.  The aesthetics of the t.v. are amazing, and the viewing quality is amazing--after a little bit of calibration.  I looked online at various sources for advice on calibrating the t.v.  I wanted to maximize the t.v. and to decrease the amount of bleeding that exists on the corners of the t.v.  As other reviews have noted, the t.v. does have bleeding issues, however, I adjusted the settings and the t.v. is great now.  I calibrated the t.v. according to the websites but I ultimately was only moderately happy because of the bleeding so I experimented a bit and turned on the black tone and dynamic contrast to darkest and high respectively.  THen i turned down the backlight to 4 and everyhing seems to be great now, minimal to no bleeding.  Great t.v., excellent price. the 3d--especially for 3d content like halo hd--is amazing.  A great buy

Reviews.Title: No problems so far - pleased
Reviews.Author: L. Adams
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with the unit and have no problems with patchiness or light leaks.  I had it narrowed down to LG and Samsung based on CR and CNET.  I chose this model more for its LED energy efficiency and look and not necessarily for 3D or Wi-Fi.  It came in a package with a Samsung 5500 blu-ray player and 3D glasses.  One thing to note - after set-up I noticed the picture appeared somewhat dim and washed out.  I assumed this was for the energy setting to be deemed 'efficient'.  I changed the picture mode from Standard to Dynamic and the picture brightened up quite a bit.  I guess it uses more power for this, but had to do it.I won't use the TV's Wi-Fi, but instead probably use the Blu-Ray player for wireless to my router and any streaming videos that I may do in the future.  I won't be using the sound functions on the TV either because I have an AV Receiver.  For those of you that pass everything through an AV Receiver and plan on using 3D, you should know your receiver needs to be a recent model to handle 3D!  (I have a Yamaha RV565 and it won't do it, or so they say).  I also recommend you get some heavy-duty HDMI cables to handle the 3D.  Samsung recommends cables of 14mm in diameter and Amazon sells some thick ones too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Reputation
Reviews.Author: Gamble_88
Reviews.Content: I have always loved Samsung products, to there cell phones, tablets, and there T.V's, but this T.V i have had for only 4 months had has 3 repairs since then. First, was a line of dead pixels, second was a double ghost image in the pictures, third was another line of dead pixels. Samsung has been very good at fixing all the problems, but this shouldn't happen with a brand new LED 3D TV,Im glad i bought the extended warranty. Its kinda ridiculous for a T.V so new right out of the box.Im about ready to say forget it and take it our back and shoot it, and just stick to Sony, Sony hasn't failed me yet. Its more of a headache then its worth. calling samsung, and setting a appointment to meet the repair guy. Love you samsung but you sold me a Lemon!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This was an easy set-up. Everything about this is working perfect right now. The motion control has to be played with and fine tuned at first. I have HD and non HD channels where it's difficult to tell the two apart now. Not only TV and videos, but Xbox is great on it. I used to be a Sony fan, but the ratings for Samsung changed my mind.

Reviews.Title: 46inches of Absolute Brilliance
Reviews.Author: Ershad
Reviews.Content: I just recently got this TV off amazon, and boy oh boy I am really impressed. The device as such is a real piece of work. Putting aside a few shortcomings from Smarthub apps like Youtube which starts off with a random channel without asking my consent, other features like Netflix and Hulu are well integrated.But I primarily got this TV for its picture quality and I am really happy with it.Will recommend for anyone looking for really awesome picture quality with the most minimal bezel interference of viewing :-)

Reviews.Title: Great Tv Bundle, great cost
Reviews.Author: Charles Young
Reviews.Content: TV is excellent. all the newest features and was not my entire wallet. The smart hub option is a great alternative to subscribing to TV channels. cost less and hulu + netflicks right on the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great for NON-3D viewing
Reviews.Author: MichaelSeebach
Reviews.Content: Please review this link before considering a purchase. This TV does not have full HD 3D it is advertised to have [...]Pros:-Thin and Light for its size (easy to wall mount)-Wifi with Smart Hub. Almost like having a Roku built into the TV-Very Bright picture-Low power usage-Very clear motion while gaming and no noticeable latencyCons:-UPDATE: _TV IS NOT FULL HD 3D_ Please read this: [...]Observations:-Flicker in 3D 24Hz. I was able to resolve this by turning the back-light down quite a bit. Not really a Con if you can keep the room somewhat dark while watching 3d movies.-"Flashlighting" around the edges while watching a dim movie in a dark room with the backlight high. This is another con which can be solved by using appropriate backlight for the room brightness. Not as much a con as something to be aware of.-Inputs are on the right side of the TV. My last TV had inputs on the left. I had to relocate my media center appropriately.

Reviews.Title: A Lemon w/ inept Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Denise0310
Reviews.Content: Very sleek TV with a fantastic picture ... when the picture is visible.  The picture on this TV, however, seemed to have a mind of its own.  Intermittently, from every 5 minutes to every hour, the picture would break up entirely.  The screen would look like electronic interference or just pixels ... I don't know how else to describe it.  This would happen no matter what mode -- streaming, playing a DVD, straight TV, through the stereo or not.  We called Samsung Customer Support & the first call was great.  They were on it.  The rep. told us they would send a repairman & to expect a call within 2-3 days to schedule the appointment.  She even gave us  her name & said to call her if we had further problems.  Then we waited.  When no one contacted us, we called back & asked for the rep. we had worked with.  She looked through her records & said that "the part has been ordered" and we would be called once the part was in.  A part?  What part?  No one had looked at the TV.  This is a brand new TV ... it requires a part?  We asked how long this would take.  2-3 days.  It was becoming clear ... "2-3 days" was the standard reply.  We waited.  After another week & no word, we decided enough was enough.  So we went online with Amazon to return the defective TV & called Samsung to cancel the service call.  I then received a call from someone who said, "I have the part for your TV & I'm coming tomorrow."  I told him it wasn't necessary as the TV was being returned.  So much for Samsung Customer Service.  Now I just have to get the TV back to Amazon.  Amazon stated that the TV would be picked up by UPS "usually the following business day, but may take up to 2-3 business days."  I expected some sort of phone call or email to arrange pick up.  The company that had delivered the TV (not UPS) had called me the day before as well as the morning of delivery -- they were fantastic.  When I received no word from UPS, I contacted Amazon.com customer service to see about when & how this pick up would be scheduled.  I was given the same information, it may take up to 2-3 business days.  Thinking that UPS would call or email, I left the house, only to return and find an "Attempted Pick Up" notice from UPS stuck on my door.  The notice said they would again attempt pick up the next day.  There were several time slots on the notice, but none were marked.  I attempted to schedule a time period with UPS online ... that would cost an extra $12 for that service.  I called UPS to schedule a pick up time.  I told them I would have been home if they had contacted me.  They said it was Amazon's responsibility to notify me of delivery date & time, & they could not give me any idea of a time range.  What a ridiculous way to do business.  I am fortunate to be retired & have the ability to sit at home for 3 days, twiddling my thumbs & hoping UPS will show up.  I sincerely doubt I will buy another Samsung product, or any large object requiring UPS pick up services from Amazon.  Inept all around, I would call it.

Reviews.Title: An amazing 3D TV! Buy from Amazon Warehouse deals and save!!!
Reviews.Author: Hugo Flores
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of sony TVs but my last TV failed on me and I just needed to try something new. I looked into plenty of TVs and my main desire was an LED TV with 3D capabilities. It seemed that with Black Friday around the corner the main focus was just to sell TVs without 3D. The only one I found affordable was the LG Walmart has on sale for $800 but that is passive 3D which is not as good as active shutter 3D.Fisrt thing is first! I highly recommend you buy the un46d6500 from Amazon Warehouse Deals. I bought my TV in "very good" condition for $920 and when I got it it was virtually brand new. The Samsung UN46D6500 has a clear bezel around the frame and mine has two tiny almost invisible cracks on the frame and I believe that was the only defect. Aside from that the TV is virtually brand new. so I saved a ton by going with warehouse deals. The TV is excellent the colors are nice and sharp and way more detailed than my old LCD TV. 3D also works perfectly with games like Uncharted and Gears of War 3. Even standard definition looks great on this TV and I cant recommend this TV enough.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40
Reviews.Author: jtsmo
Reviews.Content: This appears to be a very high quality TV. The picture sharpness and clarity is second to none. Very easy to hook up to the internet through a wireless router as no other equipment is needed.  The actual physical dimensions are very compact, leaving a very thin framining. This was a critical factor as I had a very limited space to work with. I have not utilized the 3D aspect at this point so cannot comment on its quality.

Reviews.Title: 3D Glasses
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Calandra
Reviews.Content: Second request for the 3D glasses that were supposed to come with the TV.  Please advise.  The promotion was done shortly after the purchase and I called to request that you honor 2 pairs of 3D glasses.  Please advise as I am a good customer and should receive the promotion.

Reviews.Title: TV failed, Cost to repair in second year.  Disappointing for "perceived" Tier 1 Vendor.
Reviews.Author: JMart
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV in late November 2011 based on my perception of Samsung as a quality vendor. TV is used in a light to medium duty cycle in my home office.  Warranty runs out after 12 months.  Turned on the TV this weekend to view college football, heard "pop". No picture, power on continuous cycling of on-off.  Contacted Samsung and was told TV out of warranty.  Suggested some service centers.  Bottom line, IP board failed.  Cost to repair  $36x.  Very disappointed in this quality (or lack there of) from Tier 1 vendor.  Service vendor suggested that quality and value is being sacrificed.  Life cycle in these sets are short.  Buyer Beware. If duty cycle is short...might was well purchase cheaper TV and purchase one every couple of years.

Reviews.Title: love this tv
Reviews.Author: Lucas Vance
Reviews.Content: it was a great buy the best picture quality around...still better than most tvs today...might go bigger in about 5 yrs

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55D6500
Reviews.Author: Bakerman
Reviews.Content: UN55D6500 is a great entry level TV. Great picture, but it looks like a soap opera on some programs. Lots of inputs, and as usual with Samsung, the TV itself is attractive and very thin. Remote is easy to use.I'm happy with it and I would definitely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Kranthi Kumar Kotagiri
Reviews.Content: From the day I bought it has cloud affect on the LED screen. Called several times the Samsung repair desk. No use.. Finally they told me that all these products are like this. Even if we replace the panel, there no guarantee that it will be good at least 90%!It is very annoying if you see the movies in the night.other than that everything is good.

Reviews.Title: Lot of new features, many bugs
Reviews.Author: Zerkella
Reviews.Content: The TV is great overall - good picture, many features. But there are also many bugs in it. The one extremely annoying, is that it doesn't see new files on USB HDD without doing factory reset. This is really annoying, and their support acknowledges the issue, but during 3 years and 4 firmware upgrades they didn't fix it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Need I say more? Picture is great. Bezel is small and makes the picture extends all the way to the edge..

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: Michael Lapinsky
Reviews.Content: For the most part it's a pretty great TV.  It likes to randomly turn off (crash) every couple weeks or so when we're using apps like Netflix.  The settings can sometimes be a little confusing to figure out the best image, but overall it's doing the job of a nice flat screen Tv.

Reviews.Title: Nice Image, Good Sound, Buggy Software ...
Reviews.Author: Timothy S. Shropshire "'rangsmith"
Reviews.Content: Nice Image, Good Sound, Buggy Software ... overall a really beautiful picture once you get it adjusted properly (the factory settings are horrible). Interfaces well with lots of devices, but the internal software (so called "Smart-TV") needs to go back to school.

Reviews.Title: Great color but poor integration
Reviews.Author: Sai
Reviews.Content: Pros:1) Picture quality is very good.2) Load of apps availableCons:1) Remote button's cant be operated in dark unless you use display on and keep looking at remote for every button you press. They should have had little bump tags on important buttons, especially near up, down arrow buttons.2) TV doesn't respond well to the remote, especially after TV just started. It is very annoying.3) Too much glare on the TV screen unless you darken the room. This makes it less desired in the bed rooms. Sony TV's doesn't have this problem, I have it in my bright living room, and it never had any glare.4) Smart app takes longtime to load after TV just started.Overall, it is a good TV but remote simply sucks.

Reviews.Title: Great Display, weak audio
Reviews.Author: MrGames
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short, I've been a Samsung display buff since they came out with their first LCD sets back in the early 2000's.  They make a great TV and I'm VERY happy with this model.  I'm not an A/V pro, but I do enjoy watching a quality picture on a decent set!PROS* Overall, great picture quality.* Nice integrated set of features.* Thin form factor.CONS* Speakers are very weak.  Thin TV's, by nature, have weak speakers.  You might need to invest in a third party solution to enjoy audio.* Wiring harness/clip in the back is cheap adhesive and slips of regularly.  Not a huge deal.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!!
Reviews.Author: jcalvo04 "j calvo"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this product on Amazon Warehouse.  I couldn't be happier with the price and appearance.  Super light, Super thin :  )Perfect with my Apple TV 3, and xbox 360.Good job Samsung even if the 2013 model is gonna be better.  Well worth $800.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: ThrottleJockey
Reviews.Content: I am a television broadcast technician, so, I spent a lot of time shopping for an LED LCD television. I have owned a Samsung 40-inch HDTV for over two years and really impressed with the picture quality and no issues. This new 3D, HDTV is outstanding. The set-up was easy, connected to my wireless router in seconds and the options are awesome. After a month of very critical viewing, this is the best looking HDTV that I have ever seen. My ONLY complaint is the e-manual that is way too simplistic and not being able to make set-up adjusts to the picture while watching Netflix. I would buy this same TV again and strongly recommend it to anyone. The 3-D looks incredible with Samsung's active 3-D glasses. The seller, Beach Camera, was extremely easy to deal with. I called to confirm that the TV was in stock and get the estimated delivery date. Highly recommend this HDTV and seller.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: The TV is excellent.  It was easy to set up and quickly get started.  I would defintiely buy a Samsung again.

Reviews.Title: samsung un55d6500 led tv
Reviews.Author: craigster
Reviews.Content: Totally awesome. More than I imagined. No issues. I hooked it up to surround sound system immediately, so I cant judge the sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: R. Thorne
Reviews.Content: This television is amazing. Easy setup and connection to my wireless router right out of the box. The resolution is great and beats all other brands out there. Only wished that it had a built in browser.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40D6500 40" Class 3D LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: DKSPORT
Reviews.Content: Got this TV in November as a Christmas gift really love the gift man o man wow!! GREAT CHOICESamsung UN40D6400 40-Inch 1080p 120 Hz 3D LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46D6500 LED TV
Reviews.Author: Vlad Potiyevsky
Reviews.Content: This TV is awesome. Utra-thin and light. Incredibly easy to set up. It only took me a couple of minutes to unpack, setup the base and have the TV running and connected to the home network. The picture quality is phenomenal, once connected to an HD source. The apps are okay. Not really big on using apps on the TV, so it doesn't really bother me. Otherwise we are extremely happy with our choice, and I would highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN55D6500 55-Inch 1080p 120 Hz 3D LED TV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Callisto_Star
Reviews.Content: This television is really great! The pictures are clear; the colors are rich, and the sound is very good. I have played with the Smart features a bit - BBC News. I haven't had a chance to check out the 3-D yet. At first I was a little concerned about having a TV delivered , but it was delivered quickly (faster than I expected)and in great shape. It was easy to install - my brother and I completed it within a half hour. The price was very good.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6500 46-Inch 1080p 120 Hz 3D LED TV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Sat
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. I still need to move to the HD broadcasting for regular cable but the picture quality with some of the HD streamed movies that I saw was stunning with awesome vivid colors. There is no bleeding of light for darker frame images at the seams. Setup was easy and the apps are quite cool.

Reviews.Title: Astonishing
Reviews.Author: Doug Cadmus "Coffee Aficionado"
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome television. I'd purchased it to replace a two-year old HD television of the same size. The older television had a display refresh rate of 60Hz, and the jagged artifacts while watching football and hockey, the moire patterns of folks in plaid suits and striped ties were making me a little crazy, and the cold-start time of the old-school flourescant backlighting was getting on my last nerve.The image clarity of this Samsung is stunning. I was prepared for a really good picture. I wasn't expecting to be so thoroughly blown away by the image, by the SMART television features (let's face it; an Internet-enabled TV is pretty cool) and I really couldn't be more pleased at the bang for the buck of this HDTV. I'd give it six stars if I could.

Reviews.Title: Truly Awesome Product
Reviews.Author: PaBeagler
Reviews.Content: I did alot of homework on this TV before I bought it. All I can say is Awesome. I only have it a short time So only time will tell how reliable it will be. I however can say at this point I am very pleased with this TV. The picture is truly Amazing, It's the best I have ever seen on any 40" set. This TV's style and features are second to none. If i had any criticism it would be the TV's sound system. It is adequate for a standerd size room but by no means dos it do this TV justest. But what would you expect from a TV thats so thin. Lets face it, If you want great sound you need more space for speakers than this TV could possibly have room for.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: CReese
Reviews.Content: Completely satisfied with this TV!  Great video quality!  Easy to set up and use. I would still recommend surround sound or alternate speakers.

Reviews.Title: pleased
Reviews.Author: William L. Cox
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture, great sound, easy to set up, no defects, after about 3 weeks with it I am quite satisfied with it. I don't use the internet functions, just hd satellite, bluray, and dvd.

Reviews.Title: Excellect TV
Reviews.Author: R. Gracia "RGR"
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV, great Picture, sound is better that expected - I wish more apps become available something like a Radio App so you can also listen to radio but that is a wish List. Also a way to program the remote or the TV so with one button you can select the source vs going over the list also it would be nice that you can create your own labels for the source. (so you could indicate Apple TV, Blue Ray 1 Blue Ray 2, Dish 1 Dish 2 game consoles etc.) The delivery was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Picture blur???
Reviews.Author: Jay Boyer
Reviews.Content: Just got our TV last week and love it but I do have a question.  Has anyone noticed any blur with fast motion on this TV???  I figured getting the 120hz would resolve this issue but I have noticed a little blur when watching some channels in HD.

Reviews.Title: This is an excellent TV
Reviews.Author: EC
Reviews.Content: This is an LED 3D TV, the picture quality is very good! This is a slim screen. There was a very tiny small imperfection on the picture qualify (a tiny green dot) I called Samsung and they sent a technician to my house the very next day to have it fixed. I couldn't have asked for more. The internet works great and I can watch my streaming movies without any issues.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN46D6500 46-Inch 1080p 120HZ 3D LED TV
Reviews.Author: Anand
Reviews.Content: I liked this TV very much. Picture quality is amazing. Its light weight and very easy to install.Also a very good combo deal from Amazon. Definitely will recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: kindian
Reviews.Content: This is a great system. The built in network connection makes streaming of music and videos very simple. I would definitely buy one of these again. I plan to but the same model only smaller for the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: I have 3 Samsung TV's this TV is not Fun.
Reviews.Author: Brazil D Uluwita
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this TV.I have 3 Samsung TV's this TV is not fun and lots of money gone into the drain.  Pixel Bleeding all over the screen. I opened the box after Forty Days of receiving it, as I was out of Town... therefore no point in trying to return it, and I didn't want to spent  my time calling Samsung. Therefore I am just keeping it. Very nice quality TV. But beware of the Pixel Bleeding ALL OVER THE SCREEN. Now I am looking into buy this TV from LG. LG 65LM6200 65-Inch Cinema 3D 1080p 120 Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV and Six Pairs of 3D Glasses. Any ideas or comments are greatly welcome with lots of appreciation.

Reviews.Title: A Work of Art
Reviews.Author: MOzarkian
Reviews.Content: UPDATE 3/2012:  Still working and still happy.  Just today discovered more fun and worthwhile apps.  (Samsung appears to be leading in the TV app category, from what I read online.  Amazing what they can do these days.  Play games with touchscreen phones as the individual player controls, free music, slideshows, etc.  I'm not totally happy with the way the TED talks app works, and that brings me to my only regret...not getting a TV with a web browser so I could go straight to the full site to get exactly what I wanted to see.  According to one reviewer on the Samsung site, this would have been a perfect TV except for that missing item.  I agree.  4 1/2 stars.  P.S. With further research, it appears the Samsung web browser isn't so great.  I'll just keep plugging in the laptop or using another gadget if I need to see a full webpage.---------------------I LOVE the look of this TV sitting on my black granite topped credenza.  Picked them both out in the last few weeks, and damn, I did GOOD!  Lol.  I'm awestuck every time I turn the thing on.  It's tempting to run my relaxation DVD's all day just to enjoy the pictures.  The thin bezel and deep blacks make ALL the difference.  As long as this Samsung 46" continues to work as advertised, I couldn't be happier!  I purchased a Panasonic DMP-BDT210 Blu-Ray (so easy to use) since Samsung doesn't work with Amazon streaming, and have been able to run assorted internet video with no problems at all.  (The speakers are more than adaquate for my needs, btw.)After reading many reviews, talking to other people about their Samsung and Panasonic TVs (all happy customers--I'm crossing my fingers I don't have that rare lemon in disguise), then seeing how much better this TV looked than others in stores, I knew this was the one I wanted.  I decided to save some money and order through Amazon.  My only regret is not waiting til the price dropped.  I got an Amazon price refund, but once again I was too impulsive and could've saved more if I hadn't been in a fizz.  (I knew TV sales would be more competitive approaching Superbowl Sunday and really go down with the introduction of the 2012's.  But, I wanted a TV others had tested out, and after nearly a month of remodeling the living room, I didn't want to go another week with just my small kitchen TV.)3D has been an added bonus I wasn't shopping for, and didn't expect to enjoy nearly so much.  My previous 3D experiences were at the movies ages ago.  Pretty cool, but not anything I wanted to spend more than a few dollars on.  New technology has changed my mind.  This week I've watched Under the Sea (IMAX - 2009) and Rio (2011).  Based on these two and various reviews, I agree the IMAX conversions are not the best 3D TV has to offer.  The IMAX movie did have truly realistic extreme 3D moments though.  The Potato Cod fish was even creepier as it seemed to swim right at my face!  But after watching Under the Sea, I wasn't sure if having things come at me, and sometimes having to choose between focus levels was something I wanted to experience on a regular basis.  Overall, Under the Sea was interesting, enjoyable, absolutely worth watching, makes me want to save the reefs and learn to scuba!  But Rio was pure delight the whole way through.  No fuzziness at any time, better audio in more ways than one, and an amusing "love conquers all" story that will make everybody smile.  Since I've went way over my budget this month, I'm going to have to wait a bit for "How to Train Your Dragon" and will do a happy dance ;-) when my "free" 3D Avatar movie finally arrives from Panasonic.  (SO glad I'm kept putting off seeing that movie! It's going to be awesome!)  Til then I'll keep patting myself on the back for my purchase of a Panasonic Blu-Ray and Samsung thin bezel 3D HDTV.  This is the best toy I've bought in years!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: AF
Reviews.Content: It's been almost a month, and so far so good. Not as impressed as I was hoping for, but at least everything is working.Minor drawback, is the streaming, not really what they advertise. I have a decent connection 12 mps, and not even low def movies are as they say they should be. Somebody from Samsungs help support even told me that this ("minor momentary lapses")was normal... not what you would expect from a samsung tv!Also not impressed with the "clear motion" capabilities. Maybe I need to calibrate it, not sure.Other than that, the image is very nice!

Reviews.Title: Excelente Compra
Reviews.Author: Esteban Solis Torres
Reviews.Content: Llego a tiempo en excelentes condiciones, muy buena opcion de compra. Muy bien protegido para su envio, demasiado contento con la compra.

Reviews.Title: Meh! Decent picture but HORRIBLE builtin wifi
Reviews.Author: RobD
Reviews.Content: So I've only had this TV for a couple of days now but here is my initial thoughts on it.In general I would say that it has good picture quality.  The blacks are deep and the colors are vibrant.  Depending on what I'm watching there has been some judder/blur.  Oddly when watching the show Luther from the BBC from on demand in HD I see a fair amount of judder/blur.  Not so much that it's unbearable but it can be a bit annoying.  Watching The Lord of the Rings from on demand I didn't see it as much.I have seen minimal clouding, no where near the extent that some others have stated.  This is most noticeable in dark grey scenes.  Very dark black senes I have not really noticed it.  Same goes for flashlighting effect, have not seen that much of it and only in dark grey scenes not very black ones and not to the extent that others have stated.So why only 3 stars:  The built in wifi SUCKS!!!!!!.  I picked this over the d6400 simply for the built in wifi , but it's unusable.  I can connect to my home network fine enough but getting Netflix or the Samsung Apps center to run has been impossible.  It either hangs with a small dialog box on the screen that says "Connecting" , with no way to get out of it other than to reboot the tv, or it says "Network interference. Try again later".  Every other device I have has no problem only this one.  If you are going to put wifi in the TV it should work better than this.  The most frustrating thing is going to check the network status and seeing that it can connect and that it says the network is fine.  This happens if I have the router configured for 802.11n or b/g compatible.  Oh and trying to do a network firmware upgrade is ridiculous, says it's going to take 15 hours to complete and doesn't really bounce down from there.  I liked the idea of this having the wifi and a netflix app so I wouldn't need to get a roku or something else.Right now I'll keep it for another week or so to see if I can get things working, if not it's going back.

Reviews.Title: the picture quality could be better
Reviews.Author: dodi
Reviews.Content: Love the design, however the picture quality is not perfect. We tried to play with the settings but it did not make it a lot better. Now we'll be hiring a professional to calibrate it.

Reviews.Title: NO AMAZON VIDEO!!??
Reviews.Author: NotThoseCrazyReviewer
Reviews.Content: OH well, I wanted to get one with Amazon Video. I was check the UN46C6500. Then the Amazon page told me that there's a new model, AND it is cheaper.Got it, then I realized that there's no Amazon video app. In fact, all Samsung 2011 TV model don't come with Amazon Video.  What's going on?  I want my Amazon Video. Both Amazon and Samsung need to do something!Wifi - forget it.  It works only if you open up your SSID..etc.  Going to get an Airport express to bridge the network.Apps - don't really care except Amazon, most of the apps are useless. While most people have a Smartphone, why do you want to run the same app on the TV?

Reviews.Title: Happy with Tv
Reviews.Author: James Henry
Reviews.Content: Good shipping practice and amazed with tv. Highly recomend this Tv to anyone. Very Happy. I was amazed with the picture and sound. I have surround hook to Tv and evry movie is a new exspirence.

Reviews.Title: Dont buy this if you are a netflix fan !!
Reviews.Author: Rushik Upadhyay
Reviews.Content: I bought this "smart" TV from amazon considering I don't need to connect laptop with TV for playing netflix movies as it has built in wifi and other smart apps.But this product is having very serious problem of screen blackout for netflix app, the problem is whenever wifi network bandwidth fluctuates netflix app rearrange the resolution and samsung TV screen blacks out for a second or two (I have super high speed 20 MBps comcast network)I noticed screen blackouts happen every 2-3 mins once at start, and it gradually increases.After playing a movie for 1-2 hrs, usual browsing across various apps of TV becomes terribly slow and you need to reboot this TV.I've read 100s of blogs describing same issue but still dont understand higher reviews of this TV on amazon, may be netflix is not priority for everybody.I am returning this today and planning to buy non wifi sony TV.-Rushik.

Reviews.Title: supporting arabic language
Reviews.Author: Samran S. Al Harbi
Reviews.Content: I hope to supporting arabic language.Because Arabic characters are displayed chopped.an example "ÇáÓáÇã Úáíßã æÑÍãÉ Çááå æÈÑßÇÊå" it appear "å Ê Ç ß Ñ È æ å á á Ç É ã Í Ñ æ ã ß í á Ú ã Ç á Ó á Ç"

Reviews.Title: dont buy from amazon and vanns
Reviews.Author: Rambau
Reviews.Content: Missing component and av cable adapters which should normally come in the box with the tv and samsung denied to send the parts because it should be within 30 days of purchase. Its bad experience after spending so much money and again has to spend on the adapters again. very disappointing and i will never buy anything expensive from amazon and vanns

Reviews.Title: I am so unhappy about this piece of screen.
Reviews.Author: ada@
Reviews.Content: I paid almost $1200 for this TV to have smart feature and now when I received the unit I found out that there some feature that are not on all Samsung smart TVs like web browser, I paid this amount of money for having browsing feature and now I have just TV not smart TV, hulu does not play all the shows on it, it crashes every once a while, during watching a program if I go back to smart hub it takes forever to browse the hub and it gets slow, when I turn on the TV and start the Smart hub it take 30 seconds to boot up, when I want to type something to search it take2 to 5 minutes to type with this useless interface and remote control.If Samsung can not fix my problems I am going to return it and get a regular LED TV for $700 and I will get small and inexpensive desktop for $250 and connect it to my dumb TV so I would have a really smart TV.I am so sorry for Samsung.

ProductInfo.Features:
3D Glasses not included in box, must be purchased as optional accessory
Auto Motion Plus 120Hz with Clear Motion Rate
Full HD 1080p resolution
Samsung Smart 3D TV
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung UN60D6500 60-Inch 1080p 120HZ 3D LED TV (Black) [2011 MODEL]
